_inspectorSnowReport.Report: Saturday February 21, 5:30 a.m.  The sun returns today after a snowy, stormy week. Weve received 44 inches of new snow since Monday, leaving us with excellent skiing and riding. Locals have been burning sick days all week to pounce on the powder, but youll still find scattered fluff on the frontside and loads of untouched snow through terrain gates. The west face of Honeycomb Canyon opened late in the day yesterday. Today, we expect both sides of Honeycomb to open following mitigation work. If you are just looking to cruise, 25+ beautiful packed powder groomers are waiting. The Main Street Terrain Park reopens today following a midweek rebuild. Early birds, make sure to arrive early for Ikon Pass First Tracks: Apex Express, Moonbeam Express, and Link begin loading at 7:30 a.m. for Ikon Pass holders. Night owls, weve got you covered as well: explore Solitudes winter wonderland after dark during Nordic Nights at the Solitude Nordic & Snowshoe Center.

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: 1 inch of new snow overnight, 44 inches this week!
